data.title: 2021 NetSuite Alternatives
data.meta_description: Considering NetSuite alternatives? Find 8 vendor alternatives to explore. See their key features, pricing, and pros & cons. Screenshots included.
data.text:
An enterprise resource planning (ERP) system is made up of integrated applications that streamline key business functions from a single database.

These functions can include accounting, manufacturing, customer relationship management (CRM), inventory management and business intelligence (BI).

Such systems allow businesses to manage their processes and gather actionable insight from their data from a single platform.

From Oracle, NetSuite is a popular ERP software with different modules to automate key functions.

But is it the right platform for your business?

Are there NetSuite alternatives?

The answer, of course, is yes.

However, finding the right NetSuite alternative can be challenging. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive guide of the best NetSuite alternatives on the market.

Here, you’ll find an in-depth analysis of each one and all the info you need to make the right decision for your business.

NetSuite alternatives we’ll cover:

Odoo

Brightpearl

Epicor ERP

Dynamics 365

Acumatica

FinancialForce

Sage 100cloud

SAP Business One

Introduction to NetSuite

What the Vendor Says: “Accelerate business performance using the world’s most deployed cloud ERP solution.”

About NetSuite

NetSuite is a robust cloud-based ERP platform from Oracle that streamlines back-office processes and scales as businesses grow.

What’s Offered by NetSuite?

NetSuite offers a unified platform that integrates and automates key processes like financial planning, inventory, CRM and more. The platform is accessible online, enabling businesses to quickly implement an ERP system and access their data in real-time.

Key features are delivered through the following modules:

Financial management

Financial planning

Order management

Production management

Supply chain management

Warehouse and fulfillment

Procurement

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does NetSuite Cost?

Pricing for NetSuite depends on several factors like the product configuration, required add-on modules, total user count and contract duration. The base license starts at $999 per month with access costs listed at $99 per user a month.

Interested businesses can also choose from a number of bundled editions. Reach out directly to their sales team for more information.

Pros and Cons of NetSuite

Pros: Robust platform that can be customized to fit the needs of any business. Reliable and stable software that’s accessible from any browser.

Cons: Initial setup can be complicated and on-premise version isn’t available. Integration bugs with third-party applications can lead to downtime.

Read our comprehensive review of NetSuite to learn more.

NetSuite Alternative #1: Odoo

What the Vendor Says: “Odoo is the best management software to run a company. Millions of happy users work better with our integrated Apps.”

Introduction to Odoo

Odoo is an open-source ERP software that consists of a suite of business modules. While primarily intended for small businesses, it can be customized to meet the needs of companies of all sizes and budgets.

What’s Offered by Odoo?

Odoo is fully open-source with both free and paid versions available. There are over 30 main modules that streamline key business functions with thousands of third-party applications available in the Odoo market.

The following modules are available in either version:

Ecommerce

CRM

Inventory management

Project management

Manufacturing

Accounting

Employees

Business can add new modules as needed.

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Odoo Cost?

Odoo Community is a free basic plan that includes access to a limited number of apps (e.g., CRM, Sales).

Odoo Enterprise has a free plan that includes access to only a single application/module, and it accommodates unlimited users. Then, it has two paid plans: Standard and Custom. The Standard plan costs $24.90 per user, per month (with discount included for new users) that accommodates an unlimited number of apps. The Custom plan costs $37.40 per user, per month and are for organizations that prefer to customize Odoo to fit their requirements.

Odoo offers a 15-day free trial.

Pros and Cons of Odoo

Pros: Highly customizable ERP with a free version available. Businesses can add new modules to their platform as needed.

Cons: Steep learning curve. Businesses may need additional technical services to implement the required modules. Some users note poor customer support.

To learn more, check out our comprehensive review of Odoo.

NetSuite Alternative #2: Brightpearl

What the Vendor Says: “The retail operations platform for retailers, wholesalers and brands.”

Introduction to Brightpearl

Brightpearl is a cloud-based ERP that’s built to streamline back office functions for retailers and wholesalers.

What’s Offered by Brightpearl?

Brightpearl offers a complete back office management system with features such as:

Financial management

Inventory management

Warehouse and fulfillment

Customer management

Accounting

Workflow automation

Payments

Businesses can view customer data in real-time and view how their sales are performing across all channels.

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Brightpearl Cost?

Brightpearl offers different subscription plans to match a company’s annual revenue and sales volume.

Interested businesses are encouraged to reach out directly to Brightpearl for a quote.

Pros and Cons of Brightpearl

Pros: Brightpearl offers an intuitive platform for brands to manage key back office functions. Users note positive experiences with customer support.

Cons: Brightpearl is not for every business as it’s specifically designed for retailers and wholesalers. It also doesn’t offer an HR solution.

To learn more, check out our comprehensive review of Brightpearl.

NetSuite Alternative #3: Epicor ERP

What the Vendor Says: “Be future-proof with this scalable ERP solution built for manufacturing growth.”

Introduction to Epicor ERP

Epicor ERP is a fully integrated ERP suite that is primarily targeted towards midsized companies involved in discrete manufacturing.

What’s Offered by Epicor ERP?

Epicor ERP offers a comprehensive set of features that allow manufacturers to handle every aspect of their business. The software can be installed on-premise or in the cloud.

Businesses can have additional modules installed on their system depending on their requirements.

Key features of the software include the following:

Customer relationship management

Human capital management

Financial management

Service and asset management

Product management

Sales management

Project management

Business intelligence

Supply chain management

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Epicor ERP Cost?

Epicor ERP doesn’t list pricing information on its product page. Interested businesses should reach out directly to their sales team to get a quote.

Pros and Cons of Epicor ERP

Pros: Manufacturers can adapt the software to their specific needs. Users note positive experiences with their support team.

Cons: The software can be complicated to implement. Some users note higher costs than expected.

Check out our comprehensive review of Epicor ERP for more information.

NetSuite Alternative #4: Dynamics 365

What the Vendor Says: “Accelerate your business growth with Dynamics 365, the next generation of CRM and ERP applications.”

Introduction to Dynamics 365

Dynamics 365 is a cloud-based ERP system from Microsoft that includes CRM capabilities and intelligent workflows to automate manual tasks.

What’s Offered by Dynamics 365?

Dynamics 365 provides a suite of tools that allow businesses to improve their operations and drive more sales. It can be deployed on-premises or in the cloud.

The platform integrates with other applications from Microsoft like Outlook and Word. The business apps can be deployed as a package or independently.

Dynamics 365 offers the following modules:

Sales

Marketing

Customer service

Retail

Finance and operations

Project service automation

Field service

Talent

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Dynamics 365 Cost?

Microsoft offers different pricing plans:

Here’s a snapshot of their pricing:

Marketing: From $1,500 per tenant a month

Sales: From $65 per user a month

Customer service: From $50 per user a month

Field service: From $95 per user a month

Finance: From $180 per user a month

Operations: From $180 per user a month

Retail: From $180 per user a month

Each of the modules can be purchased individually (except for Finance and Operations).

Pros and Cons of Dynamics 365

Pros: Powerful ERP software with CRM capabilities and deep integration with Microsoft products. Businesses can buy the modules they need.

Cons: Some users note a high learning curve with the software. Limited features on the mobile app.

To learn more, check out our extensive review of Dynamics 365.

NetSuite Alternative #5: Acumatica

What the Vendor Says: “Acumatica Cloud ERP is the connected business platform empowering customers to transform their business by putting customer success at the heart of all their operations.”

Introduction to Automatica

Acumatica is an ERP solution that offers a suite of integrated business management applications. The platform is built for various industries, including retail, distribution, manufacturing and more.

What’s Offered by Automatica?

All capabilities within Acumatica are fully integrated, and the solution comes with self-service tools that enable businesses to gain deeper insights in real time. The software can be installed on-premise or in the cloud.

Key features include:

Business intelligence

Distribution management

Projecting accounting

Commerce

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Acumatica Cost?

Acumatica doesn’t have user-based pricing like other types of ERP software. Instead, pricing is determined by the applications that a business wants to use, how they plan to deploy the software and their projected consumption level.

Interested businesses can schedule a demo.

Pros and Cons of Acumatica

Pros: Highly customizable dashboard and comprehensive reporting features. Several deployment options are available.

Cons: Some users note a complex implementation process and dissatisfaction with higher premiums for direct customer support.

To learn more, check out our comprehensive review of Acumatica.

NetSuite Alternative #6: FinancialForce

What the Vendor Says: “FinancialForce PSA brings predictability and efficiency to every stage of service delivery, helping the world’s largest enterprise organizations grow more rapidly.”

Introduction to FinancialForce

FinancialForce is a customer-centric ERP that helps businesses streamline and automate their financial operations. The software hosts a suite of applications that can be purchased together or individually.

What’s Offered by FinancialForce?

FinancialForce is built on the Salesforce platform, which improves communication between teams and eliminates the need to synchronize transactions. Centralized billing capabilities provide accurate invoicing. The software also offers automated revenue recognition and forecasting.

Additional key features include:

Accounting and finance

Project management

Dashboards and reporting

Employee engagement

Resource management

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does FinancialForce Cost?

FinancialForce offers a suite of applications that can be purchased together as a package or individually. Interested businesses are encouraged to reach out directly to their sales team for a quote.

Pros and Cons of FinancialForce

Pros: The software is highly customizable and offers seamless integration with existing Salesforce applications.

Cons: Some users note a complicated implementation process and steep learning curve with the platform.

To learn more, check out our comprehensive review of FinancialForce.

NetSuite Alternative #7: Sage 100cloud

What the Vendor Says: “Sage 100cloud enables efficiencies, compliance and growth. Flexible and customizable, it’s built for manufacturing, services and distribution businesses.”

Introduction to Sage 100cloud

Sage 100cloud is a cloud-based ERP platform that’s primarily built for small and mid-size retailers, manufacturers and distributors. Data can be collected, organized and analyzed across the business.

What’s Offered by Sage 100cloud?

Sage 100cloud is a subscription-based platform that offers a range of modules that businesses can add as needed. Financial processes within the software can automatically detect anomalies like unrecorded transactions and record discrepancies.

Sage 100cloud offers core modules in:

Accounting and finance

Business intelligence and reporting

Sales and customer management

Purchasing and supplier management

Inventory management and warehousing

Manufacturing

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does Sage 100cloud Cost?

Pricing for Sage 100cloud isn’t publicly displayed on the product page. However, pricing is dependent on factors like the package a business chooses and the total number of users who will be accessing the software.

Pros and Cons of Sage 100cloud

Pros: Sage 100cloud offers quick implementation of its software and a simple user interface. Businesses can choose the modules they need.

Cons: Some users note slow response times from customer support and challenges with certain customizations.

To learn more, check out our comprehensive review of Sage 100cloud.

NetSuite Alternative #8: SAP Business One

What the Vendor Says: “Gain greater control over your business or subsidiary with SAP Business One. This small business management software connects and streamlines your processes — and grows along with you.”

Introduction to SAP Business One

SAP Business One is an ERP software built for small to mid-sized businesses. The modular platform allows businesses to purchase what they need.

What’s Offered by SAP Business One?

SAP Business One offers an ERP platform that integrates CRM, sales, financial and operations in a single platform. The software can be deployed on-premise or in the cloud.

Its core features include:

Financial management

Sales and customer management

Purchasing and inventory control

Business intelligence

Analytics and reporting

Dashboard at a glance:

How Much Does SAP Business One Cost?

SAP Business One doesn’t list pricing information on its product page. Pricing is determined by the modules required and the number of users who will be accessing the software. Interested businesses can reach out to their sales team to request a quote.

Pros and Cons of SAP Business One

Pros: Modular approach allows businesses to customize the software to their needs. Users can run queries from different data sources at the same time.

Cons: Some users note a higher implementation cost compared to other ERP systems. Other users have made comments about slow loading times.

Check out our comprehensive review of SAP Business One to learn more.

The Right NetSuite Alternatives for your Business

Choosing the right ERP system can be difficult, especially given the number of options there are on the market.

Here are some NetSuite alternatives that are best for different types of business:

The Right NetSuite Alternative for Startups

We recommend startups check out:

Odoo

The Right NetSuite Alternative for Retailers or Wholesalers

We recommend retailers or wholesalers check out:

Brightpearl

The Right NetSuite Alternative for Enterprises

We recommend enterprises check out:

Dynamics 365

Conculsion

Enterprise resource planning systems can help organizations streamline and even automate many core back office functions from a single platform.

NetSuite is one of the most widely used ERP systems, but there are other alternatives that may suit your business better.

Better Buys has several resources to help you discover the best option for your business.
